faq.a1: An eSIM (embedded SIM) is a digital SIM that allows you to activate a mobile data plan without needing a physical SIM card. It works just like a regular SIM but is embedded inside your device.
faq.q2: How do I activate an eSIM after purchase?
faq.a2: You can activate your eSIM by scanning the QR code provided by your carrier or following their activation steps in your device settings.
faq.q3: Can I keep my regular SIM and use eSIM together?
faq.a3: Yes, many devices support dual SIM functionality, allowing you to use both a physical SIM and an eSIM simultaneously.
faq.q4: Do I need internet to install the eSIM?
faq.a4: Yes, an internet connection is usually required to download and install the eSIM profile onto your device.
faq.a5: Most modern smartphones, tablets, and some smartwatches support eSIM technology. Check your device settings or manufacturer details.
faq.q6: Can I use eSIMs while traveling abroad?
faq.a6: Yes, eSIMs are great for travel. You can easily switch between local carriers without changing physical SIM cards.
faq.q7: How long does it take to activate?
faq.a7: Activation usually takes just a few minutes, depending on your carrier and device.
faq.a8: Most providers accept credit cards, debit cards, PayPal, and other popular online payment methods.
faq.q9: Can I top up my eSIM plan?
faq.a9: Yes, you can top up or recharge your eSIM plan through your providerâ€™s app or website.
faq.q10: What if I face issues during installation?
faq.a10: If you face issues, contact your providerâ€™s support team. They will guide you step by step to resolve the problem.

activation.title: Activation failed?
